Title: When Rideshare Drivers Must Choose Safety Over Income: Real Stories

Body: We often talk about maximizing earnings and maintaining high ratings, but there's a line every driver eventually faces: when do you prioritize your safety over completing a fare?

I've been collecting stories from Lyft and Uber drivers who had to make the tough call to remove a passenger mid-ride. The common thread? None of them regret it.

From my research, drivers who establish and enforce clear safety boundaries report fewer incidents and actually maintain better long-term ratings. Your platform may temporarily ding you, but your safety record (and peace of mind) matters more.

What's your experience? Have you ever had to ask a passenger to leave? What was your decision-making process?

Looking to start a genuine discussion about driver safety protocols and how we can better protect ourselves while still earning.
